revised_title: Fossil Shells and Geological Differences in Wales, Ireland, and Essex
tldr: Edward Lhwyd, Keeper of the Ashmolean Repository in Oxford, discusses the differences in fossil shells found in Wales, Ireland, and Essex. He attributes these differences to variations in soil composition, particularly the presence of chalk and flint. Lhwyd also mentions the existence of a petrifying spring at Harwich and requests further information on its properties and the location of the fossil findings.
